info: Rich Text Format (RTF) is a file format that enables the exchange of text files between different word processors in various operating systems.

name: Ring
info: Ring is a dynamic and general-purpose language that aims to be simple, making it easier to maintain code and develop applications more quickly.

name: Riot
info: Riot is a simple and elegant component-based UI library that provides an efficient way to build modern and large-scale applications with JavaScript.

name: RobotFramework
info: Robot Framework is a generic open source automation framework for acceptance testing, acceptance test-driven development (ATDD), and robotic process automation (RPA).

name: Roff
info: Roff is a typesetting system containing various commands to process plain text for printing and displaying on Unix and Unix-like systems.

name: Roff Manpage
info: Roff Manpage is a standard format for writing manual pages (man pages) on Unix-like systems, using the Roff typesetting system which includes commands for formatting and laying out text.

name: Rouge
info: Rouge is a pure Ruby syntax highlighter that is used to colorize code snippets in HTML documents, supporting over 100 languages and various output formats.

name: Ruby
info: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity, having an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.

name: Rust
info: Rust is a systems programming language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency, and is designed to ensure memory safety without using garbage collection.

name: SAS
info: SAS is a statistical software suite developed for advanced analytics, multivariate analysis, business intelligence, data management, and predictive analytics.

name: SCSS
info: SCSS, or Sassy CSS, is an extension of CSS3, adding nested rules, variables, mixins, selector inheritance, and more, all with a CSS-compatible syntax.

name: SMT
info: SMT (Satisfiability Modulo Theories) is a problem of determining if there exists an interpretation that satisfies a given logical formula under a combination of background theories.

name: SQF
info: SQF (Status Quo Function) is a scripting language designed for automating gameplay tasks in the ARMA video game series, known for its execution by the game's virtual machine.

name: SQL
info: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system.

name: SQLPL
info: SQL PL, or SQL Persistent Language, refers to the procedural language extensions to SQL, such as those used in IBM's DB2 and compatible with SQL/PSM standard.

name: SRecode Template
info: SRecode Template is a template language part of the Semantic Recoder, used within the CEDET suite to generate code based on Semantic tags.

name: SSH Config
info: SSH Config files are used to create specific configurations for SSH sessions, including specifying different settings per host or user.

name: SVG
info: SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation.

name: SWIG
info: SWIG (Simplified Wrapper and Interface Generator) is a software development tool for connecting C and C++ programs with a variety of high-level programming languages.

name: Sage
info: SageMath, or simply Sage, is an open-source mathematical software system featuring a rich set of functionalities that cover many aspects of mathematics, including algebra, combinatorics, numerical mathematics, and calculus.

name: SaltStack
info: SaltStack is an open-source configuration management software and remote execution engine. It uses a central management system known as the Salt Master to send commands and configurations to managed systems, known as Salt Minions. It supports real-time monitoring, system configuration through formulas, and dynamic data collection through grains and pillars.

name: Sass
info: Sass is a preprocessor scripting language that's compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). It extends CSS by allowing variables, nested rules, and more, all with a fully CSS-compatible syntax.

name: Scala
info: Scala is a general-purpose programming language providing support for functional programming and a strong static type system. Designed to be concise, many of Scala's design decisions aimed to address criticisms of Java.

name: Scheme
info: Scheme is a minimalist dialect of Lisp with a flexible, functional, and procedural language design, making it powerful for algorithmic programming and AI tasks.

name: Scilab
info: Scilab is a free and open-source, cross-platform numerical computational package and a high-level, numerically oriented programming language.

name: Self
info: Self is a prototype-based dynamic object-oriented programming language, influential in the realm of object-oriented programming languages and development environments.

name: ShaderLab
info: ShaderLab is a shader programming language used within Unity to write shaders, combining multiple shader stages and controlling how the graphics pipeline is configured.

name: Shell
info: Shell scripting languages are used to write programs in a shell, enabling the execution of commands and functions within the operating system's shell.

name: Shen
info: Shen is a portable functional programming language developed by Mark Tarver that offers pattern matching, lambda calculus consistency, and optional lazy evaluation.

name: Sieve
info: Sieve is a programming language designed for filtering email messages. Initially created for mail servers, it provides rule-based scripting for managing email.

name: Slash
info: Slash is a programming language used primarily for data manipulation and analysis, inspired by and similar to SQL in its command structure.

name: Slice
info: Slice is an interface definition language (IDL) used by the Ice middleware framework to define the contracts between client and server components.

name: Slim
info: Slim is a template language whose goal is reduce the syntax to the essential parts without becoming cryptic, designed to speed up templating processes.

name: SmPL
info: SmPL (Semantic Patch Language) is part of the Coccinelle software tool used for writing semantic patches specifically designed to transform C source code.

name: Smali
info: Smali is an assembly language for the dex format used by dalvik, Android's Java VM implementation, allowing low-level editing and restyling of Android applications.

name: Smalltalk
info: Smalltalk is an object-oriented, dynamically typed, reflective programming language, known for its concise and powerful syntax and pioneering role in object-oriented programming.

name: Smarty
info: Smarty is a template engine for PHP, facilitating the separation of presentation (HTML/CSS) from application logic. It emphasizes clean and manageable code.

name: Solidity
info: Solidity is an object-oriented, high-level language for implementing smart contracts on various blockchain platforms, most notably, Ethereum.

name: SourcePawn
info: SourcePawn, a variant of the Pawn language, is designed for scripting in game mods. It features a C-like syntax and compiles to bytecode for performance.

name: Spline Font Database
info: Spline Font Database files (.sfd) are used by FontForge for storing font information, supporting a range of font formats including TrueType and PostScript.

name: Squirrel
info: Squirrel is a high-level, imperative, object-oriented programming language, designed to be a lightweight scripting language that fits in the size, memory bandwidth, and real-time requirements of applications like video games.

name: Stan
info: Stan is a state-of-the-art platform for statistical modeling and high-performance statistical computation. Thousands of users rely on Stan for statistical modeling, data analysis, and prediction in the social, biological, and physical sciences, engineering, and business.

name: Standard ML
info: Standard ML is a functional programming language known for its type safety, pattern matching, and flexibility in the design of large systems.

name: Starlark
info: Starlark, modeled after Python, is a language for configuring software projects and build processes, suitable for environments where changes must be isolated and deterministic.

name: Stata
info: Stata is a general-purpose statistical software, an integrated suite of utilities for data analysis, data management, and graphical visualizations.

name: Stylus
info: Stylus is a dynamic stylesheet language that is compiled into CSS. Its design allows efficient, dynamic generation of CSS content.

name: SubRip Text
info: SubRip Text (.srt) files are simple text files used for adding subtitles to videos. They include time codes for when each line of text should be displayed.

name: SugarSS
info: SugarSS is a syntax for CSS preprocessors that is designed to make CSS files cleaner and more readable with a minimalistic syntax.

name: SuperCollider
info: SuperCollider is an environment and programming language originally released in 1996 by James McCartney for real-time audio synthesis and algorithmic composition.

name: Svelte
info: Svelte is a radical new approach to building user interfaces. Whereas traditional frameworks like React and Vue do the bulk of their work in the browser, Svelte shifts that work into a compile step that happens when you build your app.

name: Swift
info: Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language created by Apple for building apps for iOS, Mac, Apple TV, and Apple Watch. It’s designed to give developers more freedom than ever.

name: SystemVerilog
info: SystemVerilog is a hardware description and verification language used to model, design, simulate, test and implement electronic systems.

name: TI Program
info: TI program files are used for writing applications or utilities for Texas Instruments (TI) calculators, which include educational tools and games.

name: TLA
info: TLA+ is a high-level language for modeling programs and systems--especially concurrent systems and distributed systems--by writing formal specifications.

name: TOML
info: TOML, Tom's Obvious, Minimal Language, is a minimal configuration file format that maps unambiguously to a hash table, designed to be easy to read and write due to its obvious semantics.

name: TSQL
info: T-SQL, or Transact-SQL, is an extension of SQL added by Microsoft for use in SQL Server. T-SQL expands on the SQL standard to include procedural programming, local variables, and management of exceptions.

name: TSV
info: Tab-Separated Values (TSV) files are a simple text format for storing data in a tabular structure, where each record is separated by a newline and each field within a record is separated by a tab character.

name: TXL
info: TXL, short for Transformation eXtensible Language, is a programming language and system specifically designed to support computer software analysis and source transformation tasks.

name: Tcl
info: Tcl, short for Tool Command Language, is a dynamic programming/scripting language based on concepts of commands, text, and dynamic typing, designed for embedding into applications.

name: TeX
info: TeX is a typesetting system created by Donald Knuth, which is popular for technical and scientific documentation, particularly for its high-quality typesetting of complex mathematical formulas.

name: Tea
info: Tea is a language designed to ease the writing of maintainable and secure PHP applications by providing a syntax that is compiled into PHP, supporting features like type inference and generic types.

name: Terra
info: Terra is a low-level system programming language that is syntactically and semantically similar to Lua, designed to be a more predictable and performance-tuned language for systems programming.

name: Texinfo
info: Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project, which uses a single source file to produce both readable online information and printable output.

name: Text
info: Text files, designated by .txt, are a standard text document format that contains unformatted text recognizable by any text editing or word processing program.

name: Textile
info: Textile is a lightweight markup language designed to provide an easy-to-read and -write syntax for converting its formatted text into HTML.

name: Thrift
info: Apache Thrift is a software framework for scalable cross-language services development, combining a software stack with a code generation engine to build services that work efficiently and seamlessly between C++, Java, Python, PHP, Ruby, Erlang, Perl, Haskell, C#, Cocoa, JavaScript, Node.js, Smalltalk, OCaml, and Delphi and other languages.

name: Turing
info: Turing is a Pascal-like programming language developed in 1982 by Ric Holt and James Cordy, then at the University of Toronto, Canada, named after the British computer scientist Alan Turing.

name: Turtle
info: Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language) is a serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs used in semantic web programming.

name: Twig
info: Twig is a modern template engine for PHP, designed to provide a flexible, fast, and secure way to create complex web pages from database content.

name: Type Language
info: Type Language refers to the way types are used and manipulated within a programming context, often integral to statically typed languages, providing a framework for defining and enforcing the data types of variables.

name: TypeScript
info: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript and provides static types. Designed for development of large applications, it extends JavaScript by adding types and provides tooling at any scale.

name: Unified Parallel C
info: Unified Parallel C (UPC) is an extension of the C programming language designed for high performance computing on large-scale parallel machines. The language includes a shared memory model for parallel programming.

name: Unity3D Asset
info: Unity3D uses asset files for storing all pieces of content used in a project, including 3D models, textures, audio, and scripts. Assets are key components for building and running Unity applications.

name: Unix Assembly
info: Unix assembly language is used for low-level programming or system software running in Unix environments, enabling direct interaction with hardware and OS services.

name: Uno
info: Uno Platform allows for building native mobile, desktop, and WebAssembly apps with C# and WinUI. Uno Platform extends the UWP model with controls and features for real-time cross-platform applications.

name: UnrealScript
info: UnrealScript is an object-oriented programming language for writing games on the Unreal Engine. It provides scripting capabilities for automating game behaviors and interactions.

name: UrWeb
info: UrWeb is a domain-specific functional programming language similar to Haskell, tailored for developing secure, robust, and high-performance web applications.

name: V
info: The V programming language is a statically typed compiled language designed for building maintainable software with a focus on simplicity, performance, and maintainability.

name: VBA
info: Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is an implementation of Microsoft's event-driven programming language, Visual Basic 6, and its associated integrated development environment (IDE), used for automating tasks in Microsoft Office applications.

name: VBScript
info: VBScript is a scripting language developed by Microsoft that is modeled on Visual Basic. It allows Windows administrators and developers to automate tasks and create scripts for administrative tasks.

name: VCL
info: Visual Component Library (VCL) is a visual component-based object-oriented framework for developing user interfaces in Delphi and C++ Builder applications.

name: VHDL
info: VHDL is a hardware description language used in electronic design automation to describe digital and mixed-signal systems such as field-programmable gate arrays and integrated circuits.

name: Vala
info: Vala is a programming language that aims to bring modern language features to C, with a syntax similar to C#. It is designed to allow access to existing C libraries without the need for runtime bindings.

name: Verilog
info: Verilog is a hardware description language (HDL) used in the design, simulation, and verification of digital circuits and systems. It allows engineers to model electronic systems at various levels of abstraction and is essential for FPGA and ASIC design.

name: Vim Help File
info: Vim help files are documentation files for Vim, a highly configurable text editor. They provide comprehensive help and instructions directly within the editor environment.

name: Vim Snippet
info: Vim snippets are reusable pieces of code that can be inserted into Vim editor sessions to speed up coding by reducing repetitive typing.

name: Vim script
info: Vim script is the scripting language of Vim, used to automate tasks, enhance the editor's functionality, and customize its behavior beyond the basic configuration.

name: Visual Basic .NET
info: Visual Basic .NET is an object-oriented programming language implemented on the .NET framework. It is evolved from the original Visual Basic language, designed to offer a productive way to build type-safe and object-oriented applications.

name: Volt
info: Volt is a web templating engine designed for Phalcon, a web framework for PHP. It offers a simple syntax and compiles to native PHP, enhancing performance.

name: Vue
info: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework used to build user interfaces and single-page applications. It is designed to be incrementally adoptable and focuses on the view layer only.

name: Wavefront Material
info: Wavefront Material files (.mtl) are companion files for Wavefront .obj files. They define the materials for the accompanying 3D object, specifying properties such as color, texture, and reflectivity.

name: Wavefront Object
info: The Wavefront Object format (.obj) is a geometry definition file format first developed by Wavefront Technologies for its Advanced Visualizer animation package. It is widely used to represent the geometry of a three-dimensional object.

name: Web Ontology Language
info: The Web Ontology Language (OWL) is used in semantic web applications to represent complex information and infer relationships between data. It is designed to be used by applications that need to process the content of information instead of just presenting information to humans.

name: WebAssembly
info: WebAssembly is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine, designed as a portable target for compilation of high-level languages like C/C++ and Rust. It enables deployment on the web for client and server applications.

name: WebIDL
info: WebIDL is an interface definition language that is used to describe the interface between scripts running in a web browser and the host environment, allowing the creation of client-side scripts that interact with web browsers.

name: WebVTT
info: WebVTT (Web Video Text Tracks) is a web standard for captions and subtitles on the web. It is used by HTML5 <track> element to provide time-aligned text intended to be rendered over a video.

name: Wget Config
info: Wget config files are used to specify parameters and configurations for Wget, a non-interactive network downloader, which supports HTTP, HTTPS, and FTP protocols.

name: Windows Registry Entries
info: Windows Registry Entries refer to the structured format for system configuration settings in Microsoft Windows, which is stored in a hierarchical database format. The registry helps in configuring operating system and applications settings.

name: Wollok
info: Wollok is a teaching language that provides both an educational environment and a language that aims to introduce programming novices to the basics of object-oriented programming and abstraction without having to deal with complex syntactical requirements.

name: World of Warcraft Addon Data
info: World of Warcraft Addon Data files are used by addons written in Lua to extend or modify game features. These addons enhance the game experience by adding new functionality or modifying existing behaviors.

name: X BitMap
info: X Bitmap (XBM) files are plain text files used in the X Window System for storing monochrome bitmap images used primarily for icons and cursors within a graphical user interface.

name: X Font Directory Index
info: The X Font Directory Index, part of the X Window System, is utilized for indexing font files to be used with the system, streamlining font management and usage in graphical applications.

name: X PixMap
info: X PixMap (XPM) is an image file format used primarily for creating icon pixmaps for the X Window System, supporting both monochrome and color images.

name: X10
info: X10 is a high-performance, scalable programming language aimed at developing high-performance parallel applications that are effectively distributed over multicore architectures.

name: XC
info: XC is a concurrent programming language based on the C language, designed specifically for programming network switches and developing applications that leverage the parallelism in modern hardware architectures.

name: XML
info: XML (eXtensible Markup Language) is a flexible text format playing a significant role in the exchange of a wide variety of data on the web and elsewhere, providing structured data representation.

name: XPages
info: XPages are part of IBM's Lotus Notes and Domino software platforms, enabling users to create web and mobile applications using XML, JavaScript, and other web technologies.

name: XProc
info: XProc is an XML pipeline language for describing operations to be performed on XML documents, allowing for the definition of multiple operations like transformation, validation, and extraction in a single process.

name: XQuery
info: XQuery is a functional query language that is designed to query large amounts of XML data, where queries resemble the structure of XML data itself.

name: XS
info: XS (eXternal Subroutines) is used in Perl programming to interface Perl code with C libraries, allowing for writing bindings to C libraries as part of Perl modules.

name: XSLT
info: XSLT (eXtensible Stylesheet Language Transformations) is a language for transforming XML documents into other XML documents, or other formats such as HTML for web pages, plain text or into XSL Formatting Objects.

name: Xojo
info: Xojo is a development environment that allows you to create native apps for desktop, web, mobile, and Raspberry Pi. The Xojo programming environment and language is designed to be accessible to beginners while also powerful enough for professionals.

name: Xtend
info: Xtend is a statically-typed programming language that compiles into readable Java 8 compatible source code, enhancing Java with features like extension methods, lambda expressions, and operator overloading for expressive and concise code.

name: YAML
info: YAML, a recursive acronym for 'YAML Ain't Markup Language', is a human-readable data serialization language. It is commonly used for configuration files and in applications where data is being stored or transmitted.

name: YANG
info: YANG (Yet Another Next Generation) is a data modeling language for the NETCONF network configuration protocol, providing a modular way to describe data structures for NETCONF.

name: YARA
info: YARA is a tool aimed at helping malware researchers to identify and classify malware samples. It uses textual or binary patterns to describe what to look for.

name: YASnippet
info: YASnippet is a template system for Emacs, enabling the automation of repetitive tasks within the editor by inserting small pieces of code known as snippets.

name: Yacc
info: Yacc (Yet Another Compiler-Compiler) is a computer program for the Unix operating system developed by Stephen C. Johnson. It is a LALR parser generator, used to produce the parsing function of a compiler.

name: ZAP
info: OWASP ZAP (Zed Attack Proxy) is a free security tool actively maintained by hundreds of international volunteers for finding vulnerabilities in web applications.

name: ZIL
info: ZIL (Zork Implementation Language) is used for coding interactive fiction, as used in classic Infocom text adventures such as Zork.

name: Zeek
info: Zeek is a powerful network analysis framework focused on security monitoring, formerly known as Bro, which is well-suited to analyzing vast amounts of network traffic.

name: ZenScript
info: ZenScript is a scripting language used within the modding community for Minecraft, primarily used for customizing interactions within the CraftTweaker mod.

name: Zephir
info: Zephir, a high-level language for PHP extensions, is designed to offer an easy to use, C-like performance optimization for PHP, allowing developers to write and compile code for speeding up PHP applications.

name: Zig
info: Zig is a general-purpose programming language and toolchain for maintaining robust, optimal, and reusable software. It is designed to replace C by providing all of C's capabilities along with modern language features and robust build tools.

name: Zimpl
info: Zimpl is a language for describing mathematical programming models, particularly linear programming and mixed-integer programming, providing a straightforward way to formulate complex models.

name: cURL Config
info: cURL config files are used to specify the parameters that cURL uses to operate. These parameters can be written in a file to direct cURL's behavior during operation without entering them in the command line.

name: desktop
info: Desktop entries are plain text configuration files that describe how a particular program is to be launched, displayed in menus, etc. They are typically used in Linux and other Unix-like operating systems.

name: eC
info: eC is an object-oriented programming language, designed as a superset of C. It integrates features like properties, classes, and templates, aimed at enhancing C's capabilities particularly in GUI development. Developed as part of the Ecere SDK, it maintains compatibility with C while adding object-oriented constructs.

name: go
info: Go, also known as Golang, is an open-source programming language developed by Google. It is statically typed with syntax and environment designed for efficiency, particularly in building simple, reliable, and efficient software. It features a robust standard library, garbage collection, and dynamic-typing capabilities.

name: java
info: Java is a widely-used programming language, known for its portability across platforms from mainframe data centers to smartphones. Java is object-oriented, class-based, and designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible, making it a popular choice for developers for building applications.

name: javascript
info: JavaScript is a high-level, often just-in-time compiled language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. JavaScript has dynamic typing, prototype-based object-orientation, and first-class functions, making it a multi-paradigm language, supporting object-oriented, imperative, and declarative styles.

name: mIRC Script
info: mIRC Script is a scripting language built into the mIRC IRC client. The language is event-driven and is used to automate mIRC as well as to create applications that perform a wide range of functions from network communications to playing games.

name: mcfunction
info: mcfunction is a scripting language used in Minecraft, which allows players to run a series of commands to automate tasks or enhance the gaming experience without manual input. It is used to create custom game mechanics within Minecraft worlds.

name: mupad
info: MuPAD is a computer algebra system (CAS) used for symbolic computations in mathematical, scientific, and engineering fields. It includes capabilities for solving, manipulating, and visualizing mathematical expressions in a flexible way.

name: nesC
info: nesC is a component-based, event-driven programming language used to build applications for the networked sensor systems. It extends the C language to support structured component-based programming and execution.

name: ooc
info: ooc is an object-oriented programming language that adds classes and features like abstract classes and interfaces to C. It compiles to C source code, maintaining efficiency and portability while providing syntactical abstractions for better code management and readability.

name: python
info: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language. Python's design philosophy emphasizes code readability with its notable use of significant whitespace. Its language constructs and object-oriented approach aim to help programmers write clear, logical code for small and large-scale projects.

name: q
info: Q is a query language for SQL-like database that is part of the kdb+ time-series database. It's highly efficient in analyzing and processing time-series data in financial applications.

name: reStructuredText
info: reStructuredText is a file format for textual data used primarily in the Python programming community. It's part of the Docutils project of the Python Doc-SIG and is used for writing Python documentation as well as in other applications where data needs to be structured as text.

name: ruby
info: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.

name: sed
info: sed is a stream editor for filtering and transforming text in Unix-like operating systems.

name: wdl
info: WDL (Workflow Description Language) is a specification language for describing tasks and workflows in bioinformatics.

name: wisp
info: Wisp is a homoiconic JavaScript dialect with a Lisp syntax that compiles to readable JavaScript, emphasizing functional programming.

name: xBase
info: xBase is a family of programming languages derived from the original dBASE (Ashton-Tate) database management system, used to develop applications.
